intro: Greuteria, commonly known as the "false hibiscus," is a genus of flowering plants in the Malvaceae family. It consists of several species, predominantly found in tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their showy, five-petaled flowers that often resemble those of hibiscus. They typically have alternate, ovate leaves and produce capsules as fruit. Greuteria species are often used in ornamental horticulture due to their attractive blooms and adaptability to various growing conditions.
